TopicTitle: Where do you get your KSP news?

Articles.Content: Where do you learn about updates? Recently, there has been some confusion (as always) around 1.1, so where do you learn about the updates for KSP? Do you feel that the information posted to the forum is insufficient?

Where do you learn about updates? Recently, there has been some confusion (as always) around 1.1, so where do you learn about the updates for KSP? Do you feel that the information posted to the forum is insufficient?

There has been a general consensus here that we are the poor cousins in the KSP information family. This is not exactly true even though I have voiced my opinion on this in the past. I would just check all the possible sites for KSP news.

Twitter appears to be the fastest method of receiving short snippets of information, such as teasers from the devs. Reddit usually gets the same information as everywhere else, but it's nice to visit to get a different take on the discussion about the news. The forums usually get information slowest, but in the greatest detail (such as the nice Articles we've had over the past few months).
I better go ask the same question on Reddit and such for a more even announcement

I get mine from the forums, by waiting for you guys to complain about how something was announced somewhere other than the forums.

Or, y'know, it being announced on the forums. Either way.

There has been a general consensus here that we are the poor cousins in the KSP information family.

This is not a consensus. Merely an oft-repeated accusation.
People often accuse water of being wet, too.
Also one thing I see is that devs like to reply to questions on Reddit, where dev comments on devote Tuesdays are almost unheard of.
I usually trawl the news feed of the Book of Faces, so thats where my KSP news come from, typically 12 hours late due to how said book of faces generates the feed.
speaking of this, was there a squadcast tonight?

Reddit, because the important stuff only seems to come out on Twitter and Squadcast. I have zero patience for the 99% crap that is Twitter and no time to watch Squadcast. Fortunately, people that do tend to post it to Reddit right away.

You'd think Squad would post the important stuff to the Announcements forum here or something, but no...

You'd think Squad would post the important stuff to the Announcements forum here or something, but no...

Here we go again.

Well there is some serious selection bias here, being that everyone who responds to this thread has to be a forum user. If you posted this on Facebook for example, more people would say that they got their news from Facebook.
Here and Squadcast. I was on Reddit for a bit but left after the Ellen Pao dramastorm. I consider Twitter for twits. And I always forget about that kerbaldevteam blog, does it even still get updates?
Wherever I happen to see it first. KSP news isn't something I actively seek out.

Forums, Squadcast (obviously) and a side of Twitter (mostly because I only actually check Twitter every other day or so).

Things tend to get to the forum before I find them elsewhere, usually by a community member.
The forums, through and through.
Forums. I don't participate in social media.

Twitter, Forums, Facebook

I think those who complain about bits of information popping up in different locations are just being silly.

  • If you are a casual player, then wait for the official announcements which always make it here to the forums.
  • If you are a crazy KSP fan, then you can stock KSP employee social media feeds and piece together little hints of information.
  • If you are somewhere in between, you can read the crazy's forum posts dedicated to summarizing hints of information they found while stocking social media.
The forums. I also read transcripts of the Squadcasts, but I don't watch them myself.
Forums, I occasionally check the twitter.

I tend to play KSP a lot for a while, then not for ages. So if I have been playing it and log on to the forums, I'll always check for new devnotes or other announcements and read them here. I always glance at the news feed when using the KSP launcher, and if there's anything new, I'll follow the link to the Dev Blog on tumblr. Otherwise, I tend to see announcements while browsing Facebook, which link either to the forums or tumblr.
What the hell happened to Facebook? It's one of the largest sources out there.

People often accuse water of being wet, too.

Describe? - Yes.

Accuse? No
I assume when they release the new version the updater will want to update to it. that's about as close as I get to news.
